snippet: A Brooklyn assistant district attorney pleaded guilty to assault and was sentenced to 10 days’ community service.
abstract: Brooklyn Assistant District Attorney Michael Jaccarino, who pleaded guilty to assaulting ambulance worker Teresa Soler as he was being taken to hospital, is sentenced to 10 days of community service; Jaccarino was intoxicated at time of incident, and says he has no memory of the assault.
lead_paragraph: A Brooklyn assistant district attorney pleaded guilty to assault and was sentenced to 10 days’ community service.

headline.seo: Prosecutor Who Assaulted Ambulance Worker Avoids Jail
headline.main: Prosecutor Who Assaulted Ambulance Worker Avoids Jail Sentence
headline.print_headline: Prosecutor Who Assaulted Ambulance Worker Avoids Jail Sentence
